abstract: While President Volodymyr Zelensky acknowledged Russian gains, Ukrainian forces pressed a counteroffensive in the south.
snippet: While President Volodymyr Zelensky acknowledged Russian gains, Ukrainian forces pressed a counteroffensive in the south.
lead_paragraph: As the war in Ukraine approaches its 100th day, President Volodymyr Zelensky said on Thursday that Russian forces now control one-fifth of the country, a blunt acknowledgment of the slow but substantial gains that Moscow has made in recent weeks.

abstract: Ukraine says Russia controls 20 percent of its territory.
snippet: Ukraine says Russia controls 20 percent of its territory.
lead_paragraph: President Volodymyr Zelensky said Russian forces had seized 20 percent of Ukraine’s territory as the war nears its 100th day. He said that Russia had expanded its control of Ukrainian territory from an area roughly the size of the Netherlands before the invasion to an area now greater than the Netherlands, Belgium and Luxembourg combined.

abstract: As the war in Ukraine marked its 100th day, Africa was urgently seeking relief from the disruptions of critical supplies of grain and other staple foods. Some of the world’s poorest countries face alarming levels of hunger and starvation and the United Nations has warned that Russia’s naval blockade of Ukraine could lead to famines around the world.
lead_paragraph: As the war in Ukraine marked its 100th day, Africa was urgently seeking relief from the disruptions of critical supplies of grain and other staple foods. Some of the world’s poorest countries face alarming levels of hunger and starvation and the United Nations has warned that Russia’s naval blockade of Ukraine could lead to famines around the world.

abstract: Congress should allow the Justice Department to sue OPEC for violating antitrust laws.
snippet: Congress should allow the Justice Department to sue OPEC for violating antitrust laws.
lead_paragraph: For more than two decades, Congress has been considering a bill that would allow the Justice Department to sue OPEC members for violating antitrust law by colluding to control the supply and price of oil.

abstract: With nearly twice as many open jobs as available workers and rising inflation, many economists and policymakers say a slowdown is just what the economy needs.
snippet: With nearly twice as many open jobs as available workers and rising inflation, many economists and policymakers say a slowdown is just what the economy needs.
lead_paragraph: This morning, the Labor Department is reporting how many jobs employers added in May. Yesterday, data from payroll operator ADP signaled a significant drop-off in hiring. But the official employment report showed that companies added 390,000 jobs to their payrolls last month, the 17th straight monthly gain. That will disappoint some economists who believe a slowdown now could be a good thing.

abstract: Jobs growth continued to be strong. OPEC Plus announced that it would increase oil production. And a report on inflation in May is coming.
snippet: Jobs growth continued to be strong. OPEC Plus announced that it would increase oil production. And a report on inflation in May is coming.
lead_paragraph: Sheryl Sandberg announced Wednesday that she was stepping down as chief operating officer of Meta after 14 years with the company. In that time, Facebook, as it was formerly known, grew into a behemoth, acquiring dozens of companies and extending its influence across the internet. Ms. Sandberg built her personal brand alongside the company, publishing “Lean In,” her best-selling 2013 book about how to succeed as a woman in the workplace. But Ms. Sandberg’s reputation suffered as Facebook faced backlash for its role in the spread of misinformation during the 2016 election, the data breach involving Cambridge Analytica and other scandals. And many of the women who once subscribed to Ms. Sandberg’s philosophy grew disillusioned as they discovered that “leaning in” did not bring about the raises and promotions she spoke of. Ms. Sandberg will remain on Meta’s board.

abstract: A conversation with the political writer Bhaskar Sunkara.
snippet: A conversation with the political writer Bhaskar Sunkara.
lead_paragraph: Every Tuesday and Friday, Ezra Klein invites you into a conversation about something that matters, like today’s episode with Bhaskar Sunkara. Listen wherever you get your podcasts.

abstract: The White House formally announced that President Biden would visit the oil-rich kingdom in mid-July despite having denounced it as a “pariah” state after the assassination of a dissident.
snippet: The White House formally announced that President Biden would visit the oil-rich kingdom in mid-July despite having denounced it as a “pariah” state after the assassination of a dissident.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Biden’s much-anticipated trip to Saudi Arabia has been formally set for next month, the White House announced on Tuesday, but officials played down the chances of securing much immediate help in stabilizing energy markets roiled by Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

abstract: Today the rhetorical war has largely been won, but the outlook grows a lot more confusing when everyone agrees to agree.
snippet: Today the rhetorical war has largely been won, but the outlook grows a lot more confusing when everyone agrees to agree.
lead_paragraph: In early 2020, Larry Fink — the chief executive of BlackRock, a financial firm whose $10 trillion in assets under management are roughly equivalent to the aggregate wealth of Latin America, and about twice that of Africa — did his best to stake his claim as the face of an environmentally responsible business future. “Climate change has become a defining factor in companies’ long-term prospects,” Fink wrote in his annual letter to C.E.O.s that year. He called global warming the most serious threat to the financial system in his 40 years of experience and promised a drastic response from his firm: making sustainability “integral to portfolio construction and risk management”; ditching investments that contribute to the problem; and pursuing not just sustainability but transparency, too, so we all could see what impacts the company was having.

abstract: Did you follow the news this week? Take our quiz to see how well you stack up with other Times readers.
snippet: Did you follow the news this week? Take our quiz to see how well you stack up with other Times readers.
lead_paragraph: Did you follow the news this week? Take our quiz to see how well you stack up with other Times readers.

abstract: Their purchases of Russian crude are undermining the West’s efforts to isolate the Kremlin and upending the global oil markets.
snippet: Their purchases of Russian crude are undermining the West’s efforts to isolate the Kremlin and upending the global oil markets.
lead_paragraph: As Russia tries to break the stranglehold of sanctions, China and India are emerging as Moscow’s pivotal financiers by purchasing large amounts of Russian crude, putting themselves in the middle of the messy war with Ukraine and a geopolitical standoff with the West.

abstract: President Biden led his Group of 7 counterparts to agree on a plan that would cap the price of Russian oil, a daunting goal that risks the Kremlin restricting supply even further.
snippet: President Biden led his Group of 7 counterparts to agree on a plan that would cap the price of Russian oil, a daunting goal that risks the Kremlin restricting supply even further.
lead_paragraph: MUNICH — President Biden is leading an effort to manipulate the oil market at a scale the world has rarely seen, embracing cartel-like tactics in an aggressive but risky attempt to undermine Russia’s war effort in Ukraine.

abstract: The change was a victory for President Biden and a setback to President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, who had justified the Ukraine invasion as a warning against NATO’s expansion.
snippet: The change was a victory for President Biden and a setback to President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, who had justified the Ukraine invasion as a warning against NATO’s expansion.
lead_paragraph: MADRID — NATO’s top official said Tuesday that Turkey had dropped its objections to the membership of Sweden and Finland, two historically nonaligned nations that, alarmed by Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, have asked to join the military alliance.

abstract: The group confirmed its decision to restore production to about 44 million barrels a day. But difficult questions remain about its relationships with Russia and the United States.
snippet: The group confirmed its decision to restore production to about 44 million barrels a day. But difficult questions remain about its relationships with Russia and the United States.
lead_paragraph: Officials from OPEC, Russia and other oil-producing countries decided on Thursday to confirm the decision taken last month to lift output by 648,000 barrels per day in August.

abstract: Many women are worried that their data might be used against them — whether it’s period tracking apps, digital receipts or other information collected by companies.
snippet: Many women are worried that their data might be used against them — whether it’s period tracking apps, digital receipts or other information collected by companies.
lead_paragraph: In the post-Roe era, when abortion may be illegal in much of the country, many women are worried that their data might be used against them — whether it’s digital receipts, period tracking apps or the vast trove of personal information collected and disseminated every day by tech companies large and small.

abstract: As secretary general, he steered the oil producers group in a turbulent era.
snippet: As secretary general, he steered the oil producers group in a turbulent era.
lead_paragraph: A prominent figure in the international oil industry, Mohammad Sanusi Barkindo, the secretary general of OPEC, died Tuesday in Nigeria, his home country, according to the oil producers group.

abstract: The Biden administration is taking a gamble that furthers our reliance on China without providing the essential elements to build our domestic solar industry.
snippet: The Biden administration is taking a gamble that furthers our reliance on China without providing the essential elements to build our domestic solar industry.
lead_paragraph: A robust solar energy industry in the United States is crucial to the nation’s goal of a low-carbon future. But the prospects for solar energy are not looking bright these days, because the United States has allowed China to dominate the industry. Failure to create a strong domestic solar manufacturing industry leaves the United States and our carbon-reduction goals not just dependent on China, but also vulnerable should China block or threaten to block its solar exports as a form of retaliation in the future.

abstract: Under pressure as tight oil supplies hurt the U.S. economy, Biden will go to Saudi Arabia for a meeting with M.B.S.
snippet: Under pressure as tight oil supplies hurt the U.S. economy, Biden will go to Saudi Arabia for a meeting with M.B.S.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase reported earnings this morning that were lower than forecasts, as it set aside bigger reserves to cover bad loans, a possible ominous sign for the rest of the banking sector. Its C.E.O., Jamie Dimon, said the bank was suspending share buybacks. Morgan Stanley’s earnings also fell short of expectations.

abstract: Unsettled times have brought a proliferation of new clusters of various countries, and the acronyms that come with them.
snippet: Unsettled times have brought a proliferation of new clusters of various countries, and the acronyms that come with them.
lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — This is what international diplomacy has come to in the era of President Biden, also known as POTUS.

abstract: In the most politically problematic trip of his presidency, Mr. Biden’s critics accused him of helping rehabilitate the reputation of a tarnished prince in exchange for numerous, but limited gains.
snippet: In the most politically problematic trip of his presidency, Mr. Biden’s critics accused him of helping rehabilitate the reputation of a tarnished prince in exchange for numerous, but limited gains.
lead_paragraph: JEDDAH, Saudi Arabia — President Biden exchanged the shaken fist for a fist bump on Friday as he abandoned his promise to make Saudi Arabia a “pariah” and sat down with the crown prince he deemed responsible for the grisly killing and dismemberment of a columnist who lived in the United States.

abstract: Jimmy Carter flew to Tehran in 1977 to meet the shah of Iran.
snippet: Jimmy Carter flew to Tehran in 1977 to meet the shah of Iran.
lead_paragraph: When President Biden met Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman of Saudi Arabia in Jeddah on Friday, he was following in the footsteps of presidents like Jimmy Carter, who flew to Tehran in 1977 to exchange toasts with the shah of Iran on New Year’s Eve.

abstract: Inflation has unmasked the depths of our affordability crisis.
snippet: Inflation has unmasked the depths of our affordability crisis.
lead_paragraph: June’s just-released inflation data is startling. At 9.1 percent, it’s the highest year-on-year rate we’ve seen since 1981.

abstract: Democrats probably won’t get another chance to pass climate legislation anytime soon.
snippet: Democrats probably won’t get another chance to pass climate legislation anytime soon.
lead_paragraph: In a column published in June 2021, I declared the coming year would be a “hinge in history” for American participation in the global effort to address the climate crisis. Having won the White House and control of the House and the Senate, Democrats had cracked open a rare window of political opportunity — their first chance since 2010 to pass major federal legislation to reduce our carbon emissions.

abstract: European Union officials have called on countries in the bloc to sharply reduce their natural gas consumption. These are some of the strategies they could use.
snippet: European Union officials have called on countries in the bloc to sharply reduce their natural gas consumption. These are some of the strategies they could use.
lead_paragraph: This month, temperatures in Britain reached a record 40.3 degrees Celsius, or 104.5 Fahrenheit, capping a brutal heat wave that scorched Europe and sent electricity demand soaring.

abstract: Our energy policy is a mess. The president needs to devise a new strategy with America’s biggest oil producers.
snippet: Our energy policy is a mess. The president needs to devise a new strategy with America’s biggest oil producers.
lead_paragraph: While it’s important that the U.S. maintain its longstanding alliance with Saudi Arabia, I wish President Biden had used Zoom for his recent meeting with the Saudi leadership. It was a bad look and bad energy policy for the U.S. president to fly all the way to Saudi Arabia to plead for more oil output when all he had to do was fly to Houston.

abstract: Politically, the paltry increase would appear to be a snub of President Biden, who went to Saudi Arabia seeking assurances from big producers that they would act to cool oil markets.
snippet: Politically, the paltry increase would appear to be a snub of President Biden, who went to Saudi Arabia seeking assurances from big producers that they would act to cool oil markets.
lead_paragraph: The group of oil producers known as OPEC Plus approved a small increase in production on Wednesday, just over two weeks after President Biden visited Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman of Saudi Arabia to seek assurances that the group would act to cool oil markets.

abstract: Also, Ukraine braces for a Russian attack and Mexico faces an extreme drought.
snippet: Also, Ukraine braces for a Russian attack and Mexico faces an extreme drought.
lead_paragraph: Nancy Pelosi, the U.S. House speaker, was welcomed to Taiwan by leaders eager to accept American support. But when she departed on Wednesday, she left behind a crisis.

abstract: Taiwan braces for Chinese drills.
snippet: Taiwan braces for Chinese drills.
lead_paragraph: Taiwan is bracing for China to begin three days of live-fire military drills today after a high-profile visit to the island by Nancy Pelosi, the U.S. House speaker.

abstract: The drop, from $120 a barrel just two months ago, could be a sign that investors are worried about a global recession.
snippet: The drop, from $120 a barrel just two months ago, could be a sign that investors are worried about a global recession.
lead_paragraph: Oil prices continued to fall on Thursday, with U.S. oil futures dropping below $90 a barrel for the first time since the war in Ukraine began, as concerns about a slowing global economy worried investors.

abstract: Elon Musk countersues Twitter. The Walt Disney Company’s bold subscriber ambitions may get a check in its quarterly earnings report. And the latest inflation number comes out.
snippet: Elon Musk countersues Twitter. The Walt Disney Company’s bold subscriber ambitions may get a check in its quarterly earnings report. And the latest inflation number comes out.
lead_paragraph: Analysts had forecast an increase of 250,000 jobs in July. And so it was a shock when the Department of Labor’s report showed that more than twice that number — 528,000 —  were added last month. The blistering pace of growth brought total employment back to prepandemic levels, a befuddling benchmark considering other recent signs of a slowing economy, including a falling gross domestic product and a more sedate housing market. Indeed, this latest jobs report provides more questions than answers about the state of the U.S. economy: What is the cause of employers’ confidence in hiring if many fear a recession? Why is the job market so resilient if the economy seems to be more depressed? These are apparent contradictions that Federal Reserve officials will weigh as they think about what path to take.

abstract: Do Americans understand the stakes across the Atlantic?
snippet: Do Americans understand the stakes across the Atlantic?
lead_paragraph: I don’t think many Americans appreciate just how tense and tenuous, how very touch and go the energy situation in Europe is right now.

abstract: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
snippet: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.

abstract: Oil is under $90 a barrel, and consumers are benefiting. Geopolitics, the economy and unforeseen events will determine whether the relief will last.
snippet: Oil is under $90 a barrel, and consumers are benefiting. Geopolitics, the economy and unforeseen events will determine whether the relief will last.
lead_paragraph: When Russia invaded Ukraine last spring, energy experts were predicting that oil prices could reach $200 a barrel, a price that would send the costs of shipping and transportation into the stratosphere and bring the global economy to its knees.

abstract: As she packs for her freshman year in college, a participant in our contests reflects on how the competitions helped her believe in herself.
snippet: As she packs for her freshman year in college, a participant in our contests reflects on how the competitions helped her believe in herself.
lead_paragraph: I was introduced to The Learning Network in the summer after my sophomore year, about the same time I was feeling the all-pervasive pressure to do something with myself. Around me, my friends were conducting scientific research and founding nonprofits. I mostly wallowed in quarantine. So when I learned about an opportunity to be part of a summer reading contest held by The New York Times (and to have my work read by real reporters!), it propelled me out of my inertia and into getting a student subscription.

abstract: The allegations by Twitter’s former security chief come after Elon Musk sued the company for more details on how it measures user numbers.
snippet: The allegations by Twitter’s former security chief come after Elon Musk sued the company for more details on how it measures user numbers.
lead_paragraph: Twitter’s former security chief sent a whistle-blower complaint to the S.E.C. and other agencies contending that the company’s spam- and hacker-fighting efforts were reckless and inadequate. The complaint, which was obtained by The New York Times, could strengthen Elon Musk’s hand in his efforts to walk away from his $44 billion deal to buy Twitter. The Washington Post and CNN first reported on the complaints.

abstract: A successful deal to restrain Iran’s nuclear program would mean that Washington lifts tough sanctions on Iran’s oil and gas exports. But it may already be too late for that to help this winter.
snippet: A successful deal to restrain Iran’s nuclear program would mean that Washington lifts tough sanctions on Iran’s oil and gas exports. But it may already be too late for that to help this winter.
lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — As Russia squeezes Europe on supplies of natural gas and Europe readies an embargo on Russian oil, some are looking for help from Iran. That is, of course, if and when Tehran and Washington agree to revive the 2015 nuclear deal, lifting tough economic sanctions on Iran that have limited its ability to export energy.

abstract: Nord Stream 1, operated by state-owned Gazprom, won’t reopen Saturday as expected, heightening fears Russia will step up its use of energy to pressure Europe.
snippet: Nord Stream 1, operated by state-owned Gazprom, won’t reopen Saturday as expected, heightening fears Russia will step up its use of energy to pressure Europe.
lead_paragraph: Gazprom said on Friday that it would postpone restarting the flow of natural gas through a closely watched pipeline that connects Russia and Germany, an unexpected delay that appeared to be part of a larger struggle between Moscow and the West over energy and the war in Ukraine.

abstract: The oil producers group is worried about slipping prices, weak demand in China and a deal with Iran.
snippet: The oil producers group is worried about slipping prices, weak demand in China and a deal with Iran.
lead_paragraph: Officials of OPEC and its major allies agreed on Monday to modestly cut oil production by 100,000 barrels a day, rolling back the increase they approved a month ago.

abstract: And a typhoon bears down on South Korea, and more Covid lockdowns rip through China.
snippet: And a typhoon bears down on South Korea, and more Covid lockdowns rip through China.
lead_paragraph: Liz Truss will formally assume the prime minister’s title in a meeting today with Queen Elizabeth II at Balmoral Castle in Scotland.

abstract: A special master will review Mar-a-Lago files.
snippet: A special master will review Mar-a-Lago files.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge yesterday ordered the appointment of an independent arbiter, known as a special master, to review a trove of materials seized by the F.B.I. last month from Mar-a-Lago, Donald Trump’s residence in Florida. Justice Department officials have not yet said whether they will appeal the ruling.

abstract: In “The Middle Out,” Michael Tomasky contends that Joe Biden is following a smart path in a time of growing inequality and financial distress.
snippet: In “The Middle Out,” Michael Tomasky contends that Joe Biden is following a smart path in a time of growing inequality and financial distress.
lead_paragraph: For those who see the Democratic Party in turmoil, poised to lose its razor-thin congressional majority in November, and then the White House in 2024, Michael Tomasky has a message for you: Calm down.

abstract: The two oil-producing countries have extended their partnership even as the United States and Europe have sought to punish and isolate Russia for invading Ukraine.
snippet: The two oil-producing countries have extended their partnership even as the United States and Europe have sought to punish and isolate Russia for invading Ukraine.
lead_paragraph: As Russia massed troops on its border with Ukraine and invaded the country at the start of the year, Saudi Arabia’s Kingdom Holding Company quietly invested more than $600 million in Russia’s three dominant energy companies.

abstract: The oil producers group, which meets on Wednesday, is worried about declining demand in a slowing global economy. Prices have dropped by 25 percent since June.
snippet: The oil producers group, which meets on Wednesday, is worried about declining demand in a slowing global economy. Prices have dropped by 25 percent since June.
lead_paragraph: OPEC Plus, the oil producers’ group, is considering announcing a major cut in production when it meets on Wednesday, according to a person familiar with the thinking of Saudi Arabia, the group’s de facto leader. Such a move, which analysts say is widely expected, would be a blow to the Biden administration, after it lobbied the Saudis to increase output.

abstract: Shares in the troubled Swiss banking giant sunk on Monday as investors worry it may not pull off a risky turnaround plan.
snippet: Shares in the troubled Swiss banking giant sunk on Monday as investors worry it may not pull off a risky turnaround plan.
lead_paragraph: Shares in Credit Suisse tumbled over 8 percent this morning, after the Swiss bank spent the weekend battling rumors about its financial weaknesses, despite assurances from its C.E.O. on Friday. Rumors among traders that the firm’s liquidity was in trouble sent its credit default swaps — securities that essentially gauge market perceptions of a company’s financial health — surging to a record, indicating deep concern.

abstract: Ukraine’s forces show no sign of slowing after capturing Lyman at the weekend.
snippet: Ukraine’s forces show no sign of slowing after capturing Lyman at the weekend.
lead_paragraph: Welcome to the Russia-Ukraine War Briefing, your guide to the latest news and analysis about the conflict.

abstract: Plus Brazil’s elections move to a runoff and Ukraine surges forward in the Donbas.
snippet: Plus Brazil’s elections move to a runoff and Ukraine surges forward in the Donbas.
lead_paragraph: An independent commission in Indonesia will investigate the deaths of at least 125 people, including 33 children, who were killed at a soccer game on Saturday. After soccer fans at a stadium in Malang rushed onto the field following a 3-2 home-game defeat, the police fired tear gas into the stands. Panic ensued.

abstract: Ukraine’s advances against Russian forces.
snippet: Ukraine’s advances against Russian forces.
lead_paragraph: Russian forces in Ukraine were on the run yesterday across a broad swath of the front line, as the Ukrainian military pressed on toward the city of Lysychansk and made gains in the south after its weekend capture of Lyman, a strategic rail hub. Any loss of territory in the Donbas region undermines Russia’s objectives, which focus on seizing and incorporating the region.

abstract: Reduced global demand may offset any supply cut by OPEC and its allies.
snippet: Reduced global demand may offset any supply cut by OPEC and its allies.
lead_paragraph: Even if Saudi Arabia and other leading oil-exporting countries cut their production targets this week, spurning U.S. efforts to keep supplies flowing, the move may barely register in global oil prices.

abstract: Plus Elon Musk suggests buying Twitter at his original price and North Korea fires a missile over Japan
snippet: Plus Elon Musk suggests buying Twitter at his original price and North Korea fires a missile over Japan
lead_paragraph: Yesterday, a brigade of Ukrainian marines appeared to have expelled Russian forces from a town in the Kherson region in the south. Ukraine has made recent gains in the east and northeast as its strategy of attacking two locations at once has left Russia off balance.

abstract: Led by Saudi Arabia, the oil cartel OPEC Plus pledged to reduce output by two million barrels a day.
snippet: Led by Saudi Arabia, the oil cartel OPEC Plus pledged to reduce output by two million barrels a day.
lead_paragraph: Saudi Arabia and Russia, acting as leaders of the OPEC Plus energy cartel, agreed on Wednesday to their first large production cut in more than two years in a bid to raise prices, countering efforts by the United States and Europe to choke off the enormous revenue that Moscow reaps from the sale of crude.

abstract: Elon Musk says he wants to revive his $44 billion deal to buy Twitter, but questions abound about financing and his ultimate plans.
snippet: Elon Musk says he wants to revive his $44 billion deal to buy Twitter, but questions abound about financing and his ultimate plans.
lead_paragraph: After trying for months to get out of his $44 billion agreement to buy Twitter, Elon Musk told Twitter on Monday night that, actually, he wanted to do the deal — on exactly the original terms. His other big ask: Let’s put the litigation on hold. The two sides are now hashing out next steps, two weeks before they were set to face off in one of the biggest business confrontations of the century.

abstract: The national average gas price was $3.83 on Wednesday, far below the peak in June but still higher than it was a year ago.
snippet: The national average gas price was $3.83 on Wednesday, far below the peak in June but still higher than it was a year ago.
lead_paragraph: Gas prices rose again on Wednesday, adding to a streak of gains that’s been propelled by the turnaround in crude oil prices after a long period of decline over the summer.

abstract: U.S. officials have been in talks with oil-producing countries in an effort to prevent global oil prices from rising sharply.
snippet: U.S. officials have been in talks with oil-producing countries in an effort to prevent global oil prices from rising sharply.
lead_paragraph: Biden administration officials have spent more than a week in discussions with their counterparts from oil-producing countries in the Middle East, seeking to minimize production cuts by OPEC Plus, the group led by Saudi Arabia, in an effort to keep global oil prices from rising drastically.

abstract: Secretary of State Antony J Blinken declined to criticize Saudi Arabia after the oil cartel OPEC Plus pledged to reduce output by two million barrels a day, but said that the United States has “made clear” its views on the cuts.
snippet: Secretary of State Antony J Blinken declined to criticize Saudi Arabia after the oil cartel OPEC Plus pledged to reduce output by two million barrels a day, but said that the United States has “made clear” its views on the cuts.

abstract: OPEC’s decision to curb oil production was a signal that President Biden’s influence over his Gulf allies was far less than he had hoped.
snippet: OPEC’s decision to curb oil production was a signal that President Biden’s influence over his Gulf allies was far less than he had hoped.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The move by OPEC on Wednesday to reduce oil production sharply undercuts President Biden’s effort to avoid an increase in gas prices ahead of the midterm elections, while setting back his push to constrain the oil revenue Russia is using to pay for its war in Ukraine.

abstract: In an attack in central Ukraine, Russian forces used what Ukrainians said were Iranian-made drones acquired by Moscow as its own arsenal dwindles.
snippet: In an attack in central Ukraine, Russian forces used what Ukrainians said were Iranian-made drones acquired by Moscow as its own arsenal dwindles.
lead_paragraph: DNIPRO, Ukraine — Losing ground to Ukraine’s counteroffensive, Russian forces lashed out at targets far from the front line on Wednesday, striking one distant city with a flurry of what Ukrainian officials said were self-destructing, Iranian-supplied drones.

abstract: The French president envisions the European Political Community as a bold way for an independent Europe to flex its muscle. Whether Europe will follow his lead is unclear.
snippet: The French president envisions the European Political Community as a bold way for an independent Europe to flex its muscle. Whether Europe will follow his lead is unclear.
lead_paragraph: PARIS — Ever restless in his quest to forge a Europe of independent strength, President Emmanuel Macron of France has a new brainchild, the 44-nation European Political Community, which will convene for the first time on Thursday in Prague.

abstract: OPEC’s decision to curb oil production.
snippet: OPEC’s decision to curb oil production.
lead_paragraph: Saudi Arabia and Russia, acting as leaders of the OPEC Plus energy cartel, agreed yesterday to a cut of two million barrels of oil a day in a bid to raise prices, countering efforts by the U.S. and Europe to choke off the enormous revenue Moscow reaps from the sale of crude. The cut represents about 2 percent of global oil production and is the first in more than two years.

abstract: The measures come in response to Moscow’s recent escalation of the war, and a day after global oil producers decided to cut Russia’s crude supply, increasing its value on the world market.
snippet: The measures come in response to Moscow’s recent escalation of the war, and a day after global oil producers decided to cut Russia’s crude supply, increasing its value on the world market.
lead_paragraph: PRAGUE — The European Union on Thursday formally adopted its eighth package of sanctions against Russia since Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine, targeting some $7 billion of trade with the country and laying the groundwork for a complex price cap on Russian oil exports.

abstract: Elon Musk is back at the negotiating table. This time Twitter wants guarantees he won’t walk away – again.
snippet: Elon Musk is back at the negotiating table. This time Twitter wants guarantees he won’t walk away – again.
lead_paragraph: Elon Musk dropped a bombshell when he put his original $44 billion offer to buy Twitter back on the table, days ahead of a court battle over his monthslong effort to walk away from that very agreement.

abstract: But President Biden did not elaborate on what those alternatives might be.
snippet: But President Biden did not elaborate on what those alternatives might be.
lead_paragraph: President Biden on Thursday defended his visit to Saudi Arabia this summer, in the wake of Wednesday’s decision by the Saudi-led cartel of oil-producing nations to cut production, which will likely raise gasoline prices in the United States.

abstract: Putin’s motivation for OPEC’s price hike is no mystery.
snippet: Putin’s motivation for OPEC’s price hike is no mystery.
lead_paragraph: Wars bring together surprising alliances.

abstract: Facing battlefield setbacks and domestic criticism, the Kremlin has escalated its war, claiming ownership of a nuclear plant and launching more attacks on Ukrainian cities.
snippet: Facing battlefield setbacks and domestic criticism, the Kremlin has escalated its war, claiming ownership of a nuclear plant and launching more attacks on Ukrainian cities.
lead_paragraph: Deadly Russian strikes on Ukrainians far behind the front lines and new concerns about the safety of an endangered nuclear power plant highlighted questions about how Vladimir V. Putin’s government, with its troops retreating and dissension escalating at home on Thursday, might lash out if its battlefield losses continue.

abstract: The announcement by the Saudi-led OPEC Plus energy cartel that it would slash oil production was widely seen in Washington as a stab in the back of President Biden.
snippet: The announcement by the Saudi-led OPEC Plus energy cartel that it would slash oil production was widely seen in Washington as a stab in the back of President Biden.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Biden faces a dicey choice following the decision by the world’s oil giants to slash production just weeks before critical midterm elections that could turn on the price of gasoline: Should he stick with his policy of wooing Saudi Arabia or take measures to retaliate?

abstract: Slower growth in China has braked the rise in world energy prices and Russian riches, but Beijing has also stepped up its purchases of Russian fossil fuels.
snippet: Slower growth in China has braked the rise in world energy prices and Russian riches, but Beijing has also stepped up its purchases of Russian fossil fuels.
lead_paragraph: Just 12 months ago, China’s economy was growing too fast for its energy sector to keep up. Blackouts darkened vast factory districts. Office high-rises were evacuated minutes before they lost electricity for elevators. Municipal water systems stopped pumping for lack of power.

abstract: Did you follow the news this week? Take our quiz to see how well you stack up with other Times readers.
snippet: Did you follow the news this week? Take our quiz to see how well you stack up with other Times readers.
lead_paragraph: Did you follow the news this week? Take our quiz to see how well you stack up with other Times readers.

abstract: A court decision to delay a trial over the billionaire’s takeover bid for Twitter works in his favor as he plots his next steps.
snippet: A court decision to delay a trial over the billionaire’s takeover bid for Twitter works in his favor as he plots his next steps.
lead_paragraph: Elon Musk won a partial victory yesterday when Delaware’s Court of Chancery agreed to delay the trial over his Twitter takeover bid by a week and a half, until Oct. 28. That gives Musk some important tactical advantages in his monthslong battle with the social media company.

abstract: The gains could raise pressure on policymakers, but analysts say the higher prices may be short-lived as refineries in California and Washington restart production.
snippet: The gains could raise pressure on policymakers, but analysts say the higher prices may be short-lived as refineries in California and Washington restart production.
lead_paragraph: Gasoline prices in the United States are creeping higher, reversing a monthslong streak of declines and chipping away at a potent talking point for the Biden administration, which had been emphasizing its success at easing pressure on drivers since the summer.

abstract: Readers suggest changes that should be considered about where we build and what we insure. Also: Migrant labor; OPEC oil cuts; preventing suicide.
snippet: Readers suggest changes that should be considered about where we build and what we insure. Also: Migrant labor; OPEC oil cuts; preventing suicide.
lead_paragraph: To the Editor:

abstract: The September jobs numbers show that the labor market remains strong. OPEC Plus announced a major cut in oil production. And the Social Security cost-of-living increase will be announced.
snippet: The September jobs numbers show that the labor market remains strong. OPEC Plus announced a major cut in oil production. And the Social Security cost-of-living increase will be announced.
lead_paragraph: Days before he was supposed to be deposed in court regarding his bid to acquire Twitter, Elon Musk changed course once again. This time, it was to return to his initial proposition: buying Twitter at $54.20 a share. He had been trying for months to back out of the $44 billion deal, accusing Twitter of misleading him about the number of spam accounts on its platform. The dispute was set to be litigated in Delaware Chancery Court this month and promised to be a messy affair for both sides. More than a hundred subpoenas had dragged Silicon Valley’s elite into the litigation, and text messages sent among Mr. Musk and his friends and business associates emerged this month, revealing a clash between the billionaire and Twitter’s leadership. But the tumult is not over. The judge overseeing the case granted a request from Mr. Musk’s lawyers to delay the Delaware trial, giving him three weeks to complete the purchase, and, as with all things Musk, the situation could become more complicated still.

abstract: The International Monetary Fund lowered its growth outlook for 2023 and suggested that interest rate increases could spur a harsh global recession.
snippet: The International Monetary Fund lowered its growth outlook for 2023 and suggested that interest rate increases could spur a harsh global recession.
lead_paragraph: The International Monetary Fund said on Tuesday that the world economy was headed for “stormy waters” as it downgraded its global growth projections for next year and warned of a harsh worldwide recession if policymakers mishandled the fight against inflation.

abstract: Angered by the kingdom’s decision to team up with Russia, President Biden signaled openness to retaliatory measures, including a halt to arms sales and allowing price-fixing lawsuits.
snippet: Angered by the kingdom’s decision to team up with Russia, President Biden signaled openness to retaliatory measures, including a halt to arms sales and allowing price-fixing lawsuits.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Biden vowed on Tuesday to impose “consequences” on Saudi Arabia for teaming up with Russia to cut oil production, signaling a rupture in the relationship between two longtime allies and a reversal of his own effort to cultivate the energy-rich kingdom.

abstract: The document, which every new administration is required to issue, was delayed last winter as it became clear that Russia’s invasion of Ukraine was imminent.
snippet: The document, which every new administration is required to issue, was delayed last winter as it became clear that Russia’s invasion of Ukraine was imminent.
lead_paragraph: President Biden declared on Wednesday that the overwhelming challenge for the United States in the coming years would be “outcompeting China and restraining Russia” while focusing on restoring a damaged democracy at home.

abstract: Higher-than-expected inflation data gave cold comfort to policymakers and investors alike.
snippet: Higher-than-expected inflation data gave cold comfort to policymakers and investors alike.
lead_paragraph: Headline inflation in the U.S. eased slightly last month, to 8.2 percent on an annual basis, according to the latest data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics. That’s still higher than what economists had expected — and markets are down on the news.

abstract: An increase in energy prices could complicate the Federal Reserve’s campaign to tame inflation.
snippet: An increase in energy prices could complicate the Federal Reserve’s campaign to tame inflation.
lead_paragraph: Gas prices fell in September, helping to bring overall inflation down slightly on an annual basis. But those falling prices were not enough to offset month-over-month inflation, which rose 0.4 percent in September.

abstract: The kingdom said it had rejected the Biden administration’s urging for a one-month delay to the reduction in output. That could have prevented a price spike before the American midterm elections.
snippet: The kingdom said it had rejected the Biden administration’s urging for a one-month delay to the reduction in output. That could have prevented a price spike before the American midterm elections.
lead_paragraph: Saudi Arabia and the United States traded rare public accusations on Thursday over the kingdom’s decision last week along with other oil producers to cut output despite American objections, signaling a new low in a relationship increasingly frayed over how to respond to Russia after its invasion of Ukraine.

abstract: Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, along with governments’ reactions to that, might mean that prices rise. Or they could fall on fears of a global economic slowdown.
snippet: Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, along with governments’ reactions to that, might mean that prices rise. Or they could fall on fears of a global economic slowdown.
lead_paragraph: Forecasting the direction of the volatile energy markets has never been easy. But experts say the complexity of market forces brewing now, in the wake of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, makes it especially difficult to predict the direction of both energy prices and the industry.

abstract: Bitten by inflation, workers are demanding a greater share of the surging profits of energy giants. It’s the kind of unrest leaders fear as they struggle to keep a united front against Russia.
snippet: Bitten by inflation, workers are demanding a greater share of the surging profits of energy giants. It’s the kind of unrest leaders fear as they struggle to keep a united front against Russia.
lead_paragraph: LE HAVRE, France — The northern port city of Le Havre is less than 25 miles away from two major oil refineries. But on Friday, the pumps at many gas stations were wrapped in red and white tape, the electric price signs flashing all nines. Little gasoline was to be had.

abstract: The president warned Saudi Arabia that it would face “consequences” over oil cuts. Many Americans still plan to attend its investor conference this month.
snippet: The president warned Saudi Arabia that it would face “consequences” over oil cuts. Many Americans still plan to attend its investor conference this month.
lead_paragraph: The DealBook newsletter delves into a single topic or theme every weekend, providing reporting and analysis that offer a better understanding of an important issue in business. If you don’t already receive the daily newsletter, sign up here.

abstract: Moscow is pressuring nuclear engineers to sign contracts with a Russian agency while pushing Ukrainians fleeing Kherson to go to Russia.
snippet: Moscow is pressuring nuclear engineers to sign contracts with a Russian agency while pushing Ukrainians fleeing Kherson to go to Russia.
lead_paragraph: Ten days after President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia declared the annexation of four Ukrainian provinces, his government is stepping up efforts to bind those territories more tightly to Moscow.

abstract: The Department of Energy will release 15 million more barrels from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve and plans additional releases this winter.
snippet: The Department of Energy will release 15 million more barrels from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve and plans additional releases this winter.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The United States plans to release millions of additional barrels of oil from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve in December and to make additional releases over the winter, White House officials said on Tuesday evening.

abstract: Investors sent the electric vehicle maker’s shares down sharply in after-hours trading after the company warned about uncertain customer demand.
snippet: Investors sent the electric vehicle maker’s shares down sharply in after-hours trading after the company warned about uncertain customer demand.
lead_paragraph: Investors punished Tesla for cutting its growth forecast on Wednesday, sending shares tumbling nearly 6 percent lower in premarket trading, despite Elon Musk’s efforts to play down worries about slowing demand amid broader worries about the economy and growing competition.

abstract: A conversation with the journalist Matt Yglesias.
snippet: A conversation with the journalist Matt Yglesias.
lead_paragraph: Every Tuesday and Friday, Ezra Klein invites you into a conversation about something that matters, like today’s episode with Matt Yglesias. Listen wherever you get your podcasts.

abstract: Some top American business leaders are headed to the Saudi business conference. But Biden administration officials, angry over the kingdom’s stance on oil production and ties with Russia, are staying away.
snippet: Some top American business leaders are headed to the Saudi business conference. But Biden administration officials, angry over the kingdom’s stance on oil production and ties with Russia, are staying away.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — The Biden administration’s message to corporate America was clear: Consider the reputation of the countries you do business with.

abstract: Washington sees OPEC Plus’s decision to cut oil production as support for Russia, but Saudi Arabia had legitimate economic reasons for pushing it.
snippet: Washington sees OPEC Plus’s decision to cut oil production as support for Russia, but Saudi Arabia had legitimate economic reasons for pushing it.
lead_paragraph: Washington is furious at Saudi Arabia: Members of Congress are demanding to freeze all cooperation, halt arms sales for a year and remove American troops and missile systems from the kingdom. President Biden warned of “consequences.”

abstract: Plus Chinese markets react to a stronger Xi Jinping and young Chinese pursue quiet dissent.
snippet: Plus Chinese markets react to a stronger Xi Jinping and young Chinese pursue quiet dissent.
lead_paragraph: Rishi Sunak, who lost to Liz Truss just under seven weeks ago in the contest to lead Britain, will become prime minister today.

abstract: After Saudi leaders pushed to slash oil production despite a visit by President Biden, American officials have been left fuming that they were duped.
snippet: After Saudi leaders pushed to slash oil production despite a visit by President Biden, American officials have been left fuming that they were duped.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As President Biden was planning a politically risky trip to Saudi Arabia this summer, his top aides thought they had struck a secret deal to boost oil production through the end of the year — an arrangement that could have helped justify breaking a campaign pledge to shun the kingdom and its crown prince.

abstract: When it comes to energy, the West wants five incompatible things at once.
snippet: When it comes to energy, the West wants five incompatible things at once.
lead_paragraph: As the Russian Army continues to falter in Ukraine, the world is worrying that Vladimir Putin could use a tactical nuclear weapon. Maybe — but for now, I think Putin is assembling a different weapon. It’s an oil and gas bomb that he’s fusing right before our eyes and with our inadvertent help — and he could easily detonate it this winter.

abstract: Democrats and administration officials are furious at the Saudis’ move to cut oil production, seeing it as an attempt to meddle in a U.S. election.
snippet: Democrats and administration officials are furious at the Saudis’ move to cut oil production, seeing it as an attempt to meddle in a U.S. election.
lead_paragraph: Only three months have gone by since President Biden gave Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, the de facto ruler of Saudi Arabia, the fist bump heard ’round the world.

abstract: Tensions are flaring between Germany and its allies.
snippet: Tensions are flaring between Germany and its allies.
lead_paragraph: Although Germany has long been Europe’s de facto leader, it has been slow to provide serious military equipment to Ukraine. It has also subsidized its own citizens’ energy bills while working to water down a price cap on gas that could alleviate pain in poorer E.U. countries. And now its allies are worried.

abstract: Disappointing earnings from Microsoft, Alphabet and Texas Instruments reveal the big challenges facing technology giants.
snippet: Disappointing earnings from Microsoft, Alphabet and Texas Instruments reveal the big challenges facing technology giants.
lead_paragraph: The recent rally in technology stocks could come to a screeching halt at the opening bell on Wednesday. Overnight, investors dumped portions of their tech portfolios after disappointing results from Alphabet, Microsoft and Texas Instruments, with the trio reporting that a slowing global economy continues to batter demand for digital advertising, cloud computing and chips.

abstract: Saudi leaders decided earlier this month to join Russia in leading a cartel of oil producers to announce cutting production by two million barrels a day, which could raise prices and help Russia.
snippet: Saudi leaders decided earlier this month to join Russia in leading a cartel of oil producers to announce cutting production by two million barrels a day, which could raise prices and help Russia.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The American secretary of state said on Wednesday that the United States would re-evaluate its relationship with Saudi Arabia over the kingdom’s decision to support Russia by agreeing to cut oil production next month, a move that the White House has asserted helps Moscow’s war effort against Ukraine.

abstract: There's plenty of bad news. But thanks to real progress, we're headed toward a less apocalyptic future.
snippet: There's plenty of bad news. But thanks to real progress, we're headed toward a less apocalyptic future.
lead_paragraph: There's plenty of bad news. But thanks to real progress, we're headed toward a less apocalyptic future.

abstract: Exxon Mobil and Chevron reported another round of strong profits. But they face political fire over gasoline prices, even as they fear a new downturn.
snippet: Exxon Mobil and Chevron reported another round of strong profits. But they face political fire over gasoline prices, even as they fear a new downturn.
lead_paragraph: The good times are back for the oil companies, but with the global economy on edge, there is more caution than celebration among executives.

abstract: A Saudi decision to support a cut in oil output infuriated Washington. But at an investment conference in Riyadh, there was plenty of praise for the kingdom.
snippet: A Saudi decision to support a cut in oil output infuriated Washington. But at an investment conference in Riyadh, there was plenty of praise for the kingdom.
lead_paragraph: RIYADH — Since Saudi Arabia and Russia agreed to slash oil production this month, President Biden and other U.S. officials have been in an uproar. But among the American business leaders attending the kingdom’s annual investment conference this week, there was plenty of sympathy for the Saudi point of view.

abstract: The president has been eager to redirect public anger over gas prices as Democrats try to keep power in Congress in the midterm elections.
snippet: The president has been eager to redirect public anger over gas prices as Democrats try to keep power in Congress in the midterm elections.
lead_paragraph: Follow our live coverage of the 2022 midterm elections for the latest news and updates.

abstract: Bumper earnings from Aramco, the world’s largest oil company, and BP were, nonetheless, a slight decline from the previous quarter.
snippet: Bumper earnings from Aramco, the world’s largest oil company, and BP were, nonetheless, a slight decline from the previous quarter.
lead_paragraph: Saudi Aramco, the world’s largest oil company, said on Tuesday that it had earned $42.4 billion in net income in the third quarter. The figure was more than double the nearly $20 billion that Exxon Mobil earned for the period.

abstract: Readers discuss the affirmative action cases before the Supreme Court. Also: U.S.-Saudi relations; climate protests; a new cabinet position.
snippet: Readers discuss the affirmative action cases before the Supreme Court. Also: U.S.-Saudi relations; climate protests; a new cabinet position.
